Schedule Advising Appointments through OneDePaul. Bio and Research Information Cynthia Putnam is a professor at the College of Computing and Digital Media at DePaul University. She is interested in human-centered approaches to design. Her framework for this field is informed by over ten years of working in industry as a visual and interaction designer, illustrator and animator prior to earning her PhD. Cynthia received her PhD in Human Centered Design & Engineering from the University of Washington. Research Area Human Computer Interaction Specific Research Area Current focus: User Experience (UX) Practitioners and Pedagogy - Exploring how UX practitioners do their work (with a focus on accessibility) to inform pedagogy and keep our HCI program current.
